stimulusHtml: Which of the following explains why the block comes to rest while on the ramp?

features.html: A block, initially at rest on a horizontal track, is compressed against a spring as shown in Figure 1. The block is released from rest, slides across the horizontal track and then up a curved ramp, as shown in Figure 2 . Frictional forces are negligible. The block momentarily comes to rest near the top of the ramp. Consider the block, spring, and Earth as a single system.
